trans-unit.source: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.

trans-unit.source: Camera profiles
trans-unit.target: Camera profiles

trans-unit.source: Camera profiles
trans-unit.target: Camera profiles

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.
trans-unit.target: This article discusses how to use camera profiles to discover and manage the capabilities of different video capture devices.

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.

trans-unit.source: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.
trans-unit.target: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.

trans-unit.source: About camera profiles
trans-unit.target: About camera profiles

trans-unit.source: Cameras on different devices support different capabilities including the set of supported capture resolutions, frame rate for video captures, and whether HDR or variable frame rate captures are supported.
trans-unit.target: Cameras on different devices support different capabilities including the set of supported capture resolutions, frame rate for video captures, and whether HDR or variable frame rate captures are supported.

trans-unit.source: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) media capture framework stores this set of capabilities in a [**MediaCaptureVideoProfileMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926695).
trans-unit.target: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) media capture framework stores this set of capabilities in a [**MediaCaptureVideoProfileMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926695).

trans-unit.source: A camera profile, represented by a [**MediaCaptureVideoProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926694) object, has three collections of media descriptions; one for photo capture, one for video capture, and another for video preview.
trans-unit.target: A camera profile, represented by a [**MediaCaptureVideoProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926694) object, has three collections of media descriptions; one for photo capture, one for video capture, and another for video preview.

trans-unit.source: Before initializing your [MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md) object, you can query the capture devices on the current device to see what profiles are supported.
trans-unit.target: Before initializing your [MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md) object, you can query the capture devices on the current device to see what profiles are supported.

trans-unit.source: When you select a supported profile, you know that the capture device supports all of the capabilities in the profile's media descriptions.
trans-unit.target: When you select a supported profile, you know that the capture device supports all of the capabilities in the profile's media descriptions.

trans-unit.source: This eliminates the need for a trial and error approach to determining which combinations of capabilities are supported on a particular device.
trans-unit.target: This eliminates the need for a trial and error approach to determining which combinations of capabilities are supported on a particular device.

trans-unit.source: In the article on basic media capture, [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), the [**MediaCaptureInitializationSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226573) used to initialize the media capture is created with only the capture device's ID string, the minimum amount of data required for initialization.
trans-unit.target: In the article on basic media capture, [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), the [**MediaCaptureInitializationSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226573) used to initialize the media capture is created with only the capture device's ID string, the minimum amount of data required for initialization.

trans-unit.source: BasicInitExample
trans-unit.target: BasicInitExample

trans-unit.source: The code examples in this article replace this minimal initialization with the discovery of camera profiles supporting various capabilities, which are then used to initialize the media capture device.
trans-unit.target: The code examples in this article replace this minimal initialization with the discovery of camera profiles supporting various capabilities, which are then used to initialize the media capture device.

trans-unit.source: Find a video device that supports camera profiles
trans-unit.target: Find a video device that supports camera profiles

trans-unit.source: Before searching for supported camera profiles, you should find a capture device that supports the use of camera profiles.
trans-unit.target: Before searching for supported camera profiles, you should find a capture device that supports the use of camera profiles.

trans-unit.source: The **GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync** helper method defined in the example below uses the [**DeviceInformaion.FindAllAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225432) method to retrieve a list of all available video capture devices.
trans-unit.target: The **GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync** helper method defined in the example below uses the [**DeviceInformaion.FindAllAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225432) method to retrieve a list of all available video capture devices.

trans-unit.source: It loops through all of the devices in the list, calling the static method, [**IsVideoProfileSupported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926714), for each device to see if it supports video profiles.
trans-unit.target: It loops through all of the devices in the list, calling the static method, [**IsVideoProfileSupported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926714), for each device to see if it supports video profiles.

trans-unit.source: Also, the [**EnclosureLocation.Panel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229906) property for each device, allowing you to specify wether you want a camera on the front or back of the device.
trans-unit.target: Also, the [**EnclosureLocation.Panel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br229906) property for each device, allowing you to specify wether you want a camera on the front or back of the device.

trans-unit.source: If a device that supports camera profiles is found on the specified panel, the [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225437) value, containing the device's ID string, is returned.
trans-unit.target: If a device that supports camera profiles is found on the specified panel, the [**Id**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225437) value, containing the device's ID string, is returned.

trans-unit.source: GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync
trans-unit.target: GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync

trans-unit.source: If the device ID returned from the **GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync** helper method is null or an empty string, there is no device on the specified panel that supports camera profiles.
trans-unit.target: If the device ID returned from the **GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync** helper method is null or an empty string, there is no device on the specified panel that supports camera profiles.

trans-unit.source: In this case, you should initialize your media capture device without using profiles.
trans-unit.target: In this case, you should initialize your media capture device without using profiles.

trans-unit.source: GetDeviceWithProfileSupport
trans-unit.target: GetDeviceWithProfileSupport

trans-unit.source: Select a profile based on supported resolution and frame rate
trans-unit.target: Select a profile based on supported resolution and frame rate

trans-unit.source: To select a profile with particular capabilities, such as with the ability to achieve a particular resolution and frame rate, you should first call the helper method defined above to get the ID of a capture device that supports using camera profiles.
trans-unit.target: To select a profile with particular capabilities, such as with the ability to achieve a particular resolution and frame rate, you should first call the helper method defined above to get the ID of a capture device that supports using camera profiles.

trans-unit.source: Create a new [**MediaCaptureInitializationSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226573) object, passing in the selected device ID.
trans-unit.target: Create a new [**MediaCaptureInitializationSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226573) object, passing in the selected device ID.

trans-unit.source: Next, call the static method [**MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926708) to get a list of all camera profiles supported by the device.
trans-unit.target: Next, call the static method [**MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926708) to get a list of all camera profiles supported by the device.

trans-unit.source: This example uses a Linq query method, included in the using **System.Linq** namespace, to select a profile that contains a [**SupportedRecordMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926705) object where the [**Width**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926700), [**Height**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926697), and [**FrameRate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926696) properties match the requested values.
trans-unit.target: This example uses a Linq query method, included in the using **System.Linq** namespace, to select a profile that contains a [**SupportedRecordMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926705) object where the [**Width**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926700), [**Height**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926697), and [**FrameRate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926696) properties match the requested values.

trans-unit.source: If a match is found, [**VideoProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926679) and [**RecordMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926678) of the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** are set to the values from the anonymous type returned from the Linq query.
trans-unit.target: If a match is found, [**VideoProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926679) and [**RecordMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926678) of the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** are set to the values from the anonymous type returned from the Linq query.

trans-unit.source: If no match is found, the default profile is used.
trans-unit.target: If no match is found, the default profile is used.

trans-unit.source: FindWVGA30FPSProfile
trans-unit.target: FindWVGA30FPSProfile

trans-unit.source: Once you populated the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** with your desired camera profile, you simply call [**InitializeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226598) on your media capture object to configure it to the desired profile.
trans-unit.target: Once you populated the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** with your desired camera profile, you simply call [**InitializeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226598) on your media capture object to configure it to the desired profile.

trans-unit.source: InitCaptureWithProfile
trans-unit.target: InitCaptureWithProfile

trans-unit.source: Select a profile that supports concurrence
trans-unit.target: Select a profile that supports concurrence

trans-unit.source: You can use camera profiles to determine if a device supports video capture from multiple cameras concurrently.
trans-unit.target: You can use camera profiles to determine if a device supports video capture from multiple cameras concurrently.

trans-unit.source: For this scenario, you will need to create two sets of capture objects, one for the front camera and one for the back.
trans-unit.target: For this scenario, you will need to create two sets of capture objects, one for the front camera and one for the back.

trans-unit.source: For each camera, create a **MediaCapture**, a **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings**, and a string to hold the capture device ID.
trans-unit.target: For each camera, create a **MediaCapture**, a **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings**, and a string to hold the capture device ID.

trans-unit.source: Also, add a boolean variable that will track whether concurrence is supported.
trans-unit.target: Also, add a boolean variable that will track whether concurrence is supported.

trans-unit.source: ConcurrencySetup
trans-unit.target: ConcurrencySetup

trans-unit.source: The static method [**MediaCapture.FindConcurrentProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926709) returns a list of the camera profiles that are supported by the specified capture device that can also supports concurrence.
trans-unit.target: The static method [**MediaCapture.FindConcurrentProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926709) returns a list of the camera profiles that are supported by the specified capture device that can also supports concurrence.

trans-unit.source: Use a Linq query to find a profile that supports concurrence and that is supported by both the front and back camera.
trans-unit.target: Use a Linq query to find a profile that supports concurrence and that is supported by both the front and back camera.

trans-unit.source: If a profile that meets theses requirements is found, set the profile on each of the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** objects and set the boolean concurrence tracking variable to true.
trans-unit.target: If a profile that meets theses requirements is found, set the profile on each of the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** objects and set the boolean concurrence tracking variable to true.

trans-unit.source: FindConcurrencyDevices
trans-unit.target: FindConcurrencyDevices

trans-unit.source: Call **MediaCapture.InitializeAsync** for the primary camera for your app scenario.
trans-unit.target: Call **MediaCapture.InitializeAsync** for the primary camera for your app scenario.

trans-unit.source: If concurrence is supported, initialize the second camera as well.
trans-unit.target: If concurrence is supported, initialize the second camera as well.

trans-unit.source: InitConcurrentMediaCaptures
trans-unit.target: InitConcurrentMediaCaptures

trans-unit.source: Use known profiles to find a profile that supports HDR video
trans-unit.target: Use known profiles to find a profile that supports HDR video

trans-unit.source: Selecting a profile that supports HDR begins like the other scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Selecting a profile that supports HDR begins like the other scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Create a a **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** and a string to hold the capture device ID.
trans-unit.target: Create a a **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** and a string to hold the capture device ID.

trans-unit.source: Add a boolean variable that will track whether HDR video is supported.
trans-unit.target: Add a boolean variable that will track whether HDR video is supported.

trans-unit.source: GetHdrProfileSetup
trans-unit.target: GetHdrProfileSetup

trans-unit.source: Use the **GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync** helper method defined above to get the device ID for a capture device that supports camera profiles.
trans-unit.target: Use the **GetVideoProfileSupportedDeviceIdAsync** helper method defined above to get the device ID for a capture device that supports camera profiles.

trans-unit.source: FindDeviceHDR
trans-unit.target: FindDeviceHDR

trans-unit.source: The static method [**MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926710) returns the camera profiles supported by the specified device that is categorized by the specified [**KnownVideoProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn948843) value.
trans-unit.target: The static method [**MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926710) returns the camera profiles supported by the specified device that is categorized by the specified [**KnownVideoProfile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn948843) value.

trans-unit.source: For this scenario, the **VideoRecording** value is specified to limit the returned camera profiles to ones that support video recording.
trans-unit.target: For this scenario, the **VideoRecording** value is specified to limit the returned camera profiles to ones that support video recording.

trans-unit.source: Loop through the returned list of camera profiles.
trans-unit.target: Loop through the returned list of camera profiles.

trans-unit.source: For each camera profile, loop through each [**VideoProfileMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926695) in the profile checking to see if the [**IsHdrVideoSupported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926698) property is true.
trans-unit.target: For each camera profile, loop through each [**VideoProfileMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926695) in the profile checking to see if the [**IsHdrVideoSupported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926698) property is true.

trans-unit.source: Once a suitable media description is found, break out of the loop and assign the profile and description objects to the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** object.
trans-unit.target: Once a suitable media description is found, break out of the loop and assign the profile and description objects to the **MediaCaptureInitializationSettings** object.

trans-unit.source: FindHDRProfile
trans-unit.target: FindHDRProfile

trans-unit.source: Determine if a device supports simultaneous photo and video capture
trans-unit.target: Determine if a device supports simultaneous photo and video capture

trans-unit.source: Many devices support capturing photos and video simultaneously.
trans-unit.target: Many devices support capturing photos and video simultaneously.

trans-unit.source: To determine if a capture device supports this, call [**MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926708) to get all of the camera profiles supported by the device.
trans-unit.target: To determine if a capture device supports this, call [**MediaCapture.FindAllVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926708) to get all of the camera profiles supported by the device.

trans-unit.source: Use a link query to find a profile that has at least one entry for both [**SupportedPhotoMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926703) and [**SupportedRecordMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926705) which means that the profile supports simultaneous capture.
trans-unit.target: Use a link query to find a profile that has at least one entry for both [**SupportedPhotoMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926703) and [**SupportedRecordMediaDescription**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926705) which means that the profile supports simultaneous capture.

trans-unit.source: GetPhotoAndVideoSupport
trans-unit.target: GetPhotoAndVideoSupport

trans-unit.source: You can refine this query to look for profiles that support specific resolutions or other capabilities in addition to simultaneous video record.
trans-unit.target: You can refine this query to look for profiles that support specific resolutions or other capabilities in addition to simultaneous video record.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the [**MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926710) and specify the [**BalancedVideoAndPhoto**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn948843) value to retrieve profiles that support simultaneous capture, but querying all profiles will provide more complete results.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the [**MediaCapture.FindKnownVideoProfiles**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn926710) and specify the [**BalancedVideoAndPhoto**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn948843) value to retrieve profiles that support simultaneous capture, but querying all profiles will provide more complete results.

trans-unit.target: Related topics
